intro: Ophiorrhiza govidjoensis, commonly known as the Kudumi tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Ophiorrhiza govidjoensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
